definition:
Let $S$ be a set in ${\mathbb{R}}^n$ and suppose that $S$ is
triangulable. ($S$ is *triangulable* means that when regarded as a
space, it has a triangulation.)

If there is a homeomorphism $h: {\mathbb{R}}^n \to {\mathbb{R}}^n$ such
that $h(S)$ is a polyhedron, we say that $S$ is *tamely imbedded*.

If $S$ is triangulable but no such homeomorphism exists $S$ is said to
be *wild*.

In ${\mathbb{R}}^2$ every 1-sphere is tamely imbedded. But in
${\mathbb{R}}^3$ there are wild arcs, 1-spheres and 2-spheres.
